attributes.action: Training for Solicitor’s & Sheriff’s in Family Courts on Domestic Abuse
attributes.additional_details: Domestic Abuse is a Parenting Choice however despite this Sheriffs are failing survivors & putting children at risk from the abuser their mother fled from. Too often Family Courts will only exercise the “fathers rights” with no concern for the safety of the child & detrimental impact on the child’s mother. Sheriff’s & too many “Family Solicitor’s” lack any understanding of abuse & become enablers in allowing the abuse to continue.
attributes.background: As a survivor of Domestic Abuse & a victim of the failings of Family Court System, I believe there has to be compulsory training for Solicitors & Sheriffs in Family Courts on Coercive Control & Domestic Abuse. To understand that abusers use Family Courts & Legal Aid to continue the abuse.

rejection.details:
This would be a decision for the Sheriff Courts, rather than the UK Government or Parliament. You can find out how to contact the Scottish Courts here:

https://www.scotcourts.gov.uk/about-the-scottish-court-service/contact-us

The Law Society of Scotland is the professional governing body for Scottish solicitors. You can find out how to contact them here:

https://www.lawscot.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
